pageContext.claim: “They came up, and from day one they worked. Nobody has seen anybody work like that. And they put the -- essentially barbed wire -- but it's called barbed wire times 10. And it was very effective, to put it mildly. Very effective. Without that, we would have been -- it would have been a stampede right into our country.”
pageContext.analysis: The military is allowed to do few things inside the U.S. They did provide support the National Guard troops and Border Patrol, but it's misleading to suggest there would have been "a stampede" had they not arrived. The majority of the caravan that reached the U.S. border has been waiting for asylum interviews in Mexico and many experts questioned why troops were deployed to the border at all given the constraints on what they can and can't do.
